page.title: 11TRANSPORT
page.content:
LIDLINGTON IS SITUATED ON A BRANCH RAILWAY LINE LINKING BEDFORD WITH BLETCHLEY AND CONNECTS UP TO MAINLINE SERVICES ALL OVER THE COUNTRY.TRAINS RUN EVERY HOUR AT PEAK TIMES BUT LESS FREQUENTLY IN THE MIDDLE OF THE DAY. ONE BUS IN THE MORNING TRANSPORTS PASSENGERS TO BEDFORD AND RETURNS IN THE EVENING.
ABOUT 70% OF VILLAGERS OWN THEIR OWN CARS, MANY HAVE TWO.BICYCLES ARE USED FOR SHORT JOURNEYS AND BY CHILDREN. SCHOOL BUSES CONVEY CHILDREN TO MIDDLE AND UPPER SCHOOLS. THE RURAL TRANSPORT ASSOCIATION RUNS A WEEKLY BUS TO A LOCAL SUPERMARKET AND DAY TRIPS.
